definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory

sentences.english: Last season was a humiliating homecoming.
sentences.chinese: 上赛季荣归故里是演砸了。

sentences.english: Spain's triumphant national football team has returned home from South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国家足球队从南非得胜荣归。

sentences.english: Gonzalez is back home after being deployed to Iraq three times.
sentences.chinese: Gonzalez被派往伊拉克三次后荣归故里。

sentences.english: It was the kind of homecoming that Tyrion wished for as well.
sentences.chinese: 那也是提利昂希望的那种荣归故里。

definition: to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
to return in triumph/to return victorious
to return home/fig. to retire from public life
lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
(formal) birthday/anniversary of the founding of an organization
